== Who I am ==

My name is Abdur Rahman, and I have been a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team
since February 2025.

I graduated with Masters (by research) in Computer Engineering from University of Waterloo. Prior to that I had two years of work experience in Embedded and Machine Learning industry where I have held position as lead firmware developer. My masters thesis and research was particularly on RISC-V where I worked on hardware software co-design and software development (compilers, firmware, linux device drivers, hypervisor integration) for an Advanced Performance Monitoring Unit for hetrogeneous systems. I have also served as Teaching Assitant for various courses as well as held the responsibility to develop lab exercises for Embedded Computer Systems course which included development of multicore baremetal, hardware accelerated video decoder. Overall, I have been involved with linux and systems development for the past 5 years.

=== My Ubuntu story ===

I have been interested in linux systems for a long time. My first interaction started with some lightweight distros when I was trying to revive an old PC back around 2012. A year later, I decided to give the popular Ubuntu a go on my main desktop and absolutely loved it.

=== My involvement ===

As a part of Canonical's Kernel Team, I am heavily involved in the Ubuntu SRU process, where I have prepared several packages which have been sponsored and uploaded. I am specifically involved in Nvidia partner projects on server class (DGX) and embedded class (Tegra) systems. My responsibilities in this area include regular kernel cranks, kernel performance testing, patch reviews and handling cases from Nvidia partner. Apart from my kernel cranks, I often work on updating our regression test suites. I have fixed bugs in several test cases as of now. I have also done a CVE rotation where I focused on backporting fixes for CVEs and submitting the patches to Ubuntu Kernel Team Mailing and Canonical ESM mailing lists.

==== Respins ====
I have also participated in some kernel respins including jammy:linux-gcp-6.8 and jammy:linux-nvidia-tegra-igx. 

=== Plans for the Future ===

I intend to handle more of the customer cases to build specific expertise in Nvidia kernels.

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----

=== Noah Wager (nwager) ===
==== General feedback ====
I worked closely with Abdur in both cranking kernels and handling the NVIDIA partner projects. He quickly became acquainted with both cranking and NVIDIA's intricacies, and has taken full ownership cranking of the jammy:linux-nvidia-tegra-igx kernel (no small feat, due to it's unconventional packaging of multiple branches of NVIDIA's out-of-tree modules). I am impressed with both the quality of his work and the wide range of tasks for which he is responsible, and because of that, I fully support his upload rights application.

==== General feedback ====
Abdur and I work closely together on NVIDIA projects, and I have walked him through a number of more general kernel team tasks, including cranking/respinning kernels, improving testing infrastructure, and resolving bugs. I have reviewed and sponsored a great number of Abdur's prepared kernels. When there were issues early on he would quickly understand my feedback and resolve them, and there have not been any issues in a good while. He's demonstrated his ability to prepare kernel packaging, and I have full confidence that he can be trusted with the responsibility of kernel package upload rights.

=== Stefan Bader ===
==== General feedback ====

I sponsored a few kernels for Abdur (obviously 32). Overall I cannot recall any issues which were not resolved in one or rounds of review. None of this recently. So at least within the boundaries of the cranking process I trust Abdur to work on his own.
This is not meant as a negative, rather to encourage to not hesitate and reach out to other team members should things look suspicious. The process we built around packaging may break and with the limited time we have in education it is not possible to have insight into all aspects of it.
With that said I approve the application for PPU rights of Abdur.
